text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Amiga computer line was produced by Commodore between 1985 and 1992. Its early entries use the Motorola 68000 microprocessor in conjunction with custom hardware for graphics and sound acceleration, capable of multitasking, running games, production software, and more. The Amiga 500, the first entry-level product in the family, is one of the more well-known models. Over the years, the hardware available would be incrementially improved. The last models, the Amiga 1200 and 4000T, would be discontinued in 1996.
